Package com.dua3.utility.fx.controls

Class InputDialogPane<R>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.control.DialogPane
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.InputDialogPane<R>
Type Parameters:
R - the type of the result produced by the input dialog pane
All Implemented Interfaces:
Supplier<@Nullable R>, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
InputPane, PromptPane
public abstract class InputDialogPane<R> extends javafx.scene.control.DialogPane implements Supplier<@Nullable R>
An abstract base class for dialog panes that handles input and maintains a validity state. This class also manages button actions within the dialog pane.

  • Property Details

    • valid

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty validProperty
      Get the valid state property.

      This boolean property indicates the validity state of the input in the dialog pane. It is used to dynamically track and manage whether the input provided by the user meets certain predefined validation criteria.

      The default value for this property is false, meaning the input is considered invalid until explicitly validated or updated by the dialog's logic.

      + This property is bound to the validation mechanisms within the dialog pane, allowing it to automatically update based on user interactions or changes in the input fields.

      See Also:
      • validProperty()

  • Field Details

    • valid

      protected final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty valid
      Property holding the valid state.
      See Also:
      • validProperty()

    • buttons

      protected final List<ButtonDef<? super R>> buttons
      A collection of button definitions used to configure actions and behavior within an InputDialogPane. Each item in this list represents a ButtonDef instance that specifies the type, action, result handling, and enablement state for a button.

      This list is initialized as an empty ArrayList and is typically populated by invoking methods that define the buttons for the dialog pane. The order of buttons in this list reflects their intended arrangement within the dialog.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputDialogPane

      protected InputDialogPane()
      Constructor.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public abstract void init()
      Initializes the input dialog pane, setting up necessary configurations or state required before the pane is displayed. This method should be invoked prior to rendering the dialog pane to ensure all components are properly prepared.

      Concrete implementations must define the behavior for initializing input fields, validation logic, and any other setup needed for the dialog pane.

    • validProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty validProperty()
      Get the valid state property.

      This boolean property indicates the validity state of the input in the dialog pane. It is used to dynamically track and manage whether the input provided by the user meets certain predefined validation criteria.

      The default value for this property is false, meaning the input is considered invalid until explicitly validated or updated by the dialog's logic.

      + This property is bound to the validation mechanisms within the dialog pane, allowing it to automatically update based on user interactions or changes in the input fields.

      Returns:
      the valid property

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks and returns the validity state of the input in the dialog pane.

      This method retrieves the current value of the valid property, which indicates whether the user input meets the required validation criteria.

      Returns:
      true if the input is valid, otherwise false.

    • addButton

      public void addButton(javafx.scene.control.ButtonType type, @Nullable DialogPaneBuilder.ResultHandler<? super @Nullable R> resultHandler, Consumer<? super InputDialogPane<R>> action, @Nullable Function<InputDialogPane<R>,javafx.beans.binding.BooleanExpression> enabled)
      Adds a button to the dialog pane with the specified type, result handler, action, and enablement state. The button is configured to handle actions, execute specified logic, and optionally bind its enablement state to a BooleanExpression.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the button to add
      resultHandler - an optional result handler to process the action associated with the button; can be null
      action - a consumer that performs an action on the InputDialogPane when the button is triggered
      enabled - an optional BooleanExpression that determines if the button should be enabled or disabled dynamically; can be null

    • createButton

      protected javafx.scene.Node createButton(javafx.scene.control.ButtonType buttonType)
      Overrides:
      createButton in class javafx.scene.control.DialogPane
